definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The sheriff was killed by his rival.
sentences.chinese: 司法官被他的對手殺死。

sentences.english: And the sheriff thanked the suspect.
sentences.chinese: 司法官對嫌疑人表達了謝意。

sentences.english: Or have him evicted by the sheriff.
sentences.chinese: 要麼由司法官把他從這兒趕出去。

sentences.english: "Junzheng" was judicial official in the army which originated in the later stage of Spring and Autumn period.
sentences.chinese: 軍正爲軍中司法官員，出現於春秋末期。

sentences.english: The recent mass corruption scandal by judiciary judges shocked the community.
sentences.chinese: 近日發生司法官集體貪瀆等事件震驚社會大衆。

sentences.english: Court verdict is the judgment verdict for the law cases of the ancient Chinese legislative officials.
sentences.chinese: 判詞是古代司法官員審理案件的具結文書。

sentences.english: The highest judicial appointments and made by the Queen on the advice of the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 最高級別的司法官任命由女王根據首相的建議做出。

sentences.english: The magistrate must commit him to prison .
sentences.chinese: 司法官須將他交付監獄。

sentences.english: The sheriff convicted the man of murder.
sentences.chinese: 司法官宣判那人犯有謀殺罪。

sentences.english: During the proceedings, the judge's trial skill was necessary to settle a lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 在訴訟中，司法官的審判技巧也是正確斷案所必需的。

definition: Judicial Yuan, the high court under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
grand justice/high court justice/supreme court justice
xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]/the designation for a punishment
Commandant of Justice in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
